definitions.definition: morally good, justified, or acceptable.
examples: I hope we're doing the right thing
synonyms: legal "it wouldn't be right to do that"

definitions.definition: true or correct as a fact.
examples: I'm not sure I know the right answer
synonyms: formal "Mr. Hubert had the right answer"

definitions.definition: correct in one's opinion or judgment.
examples: she was right about Tom having no money
synonyms: formal "Mr. Hubert had the right answer"

definitions.definition: used as an interrogative at the end of a statement as a way of inviting agreement, approval, or confirmation.
examples: exclamation: right

definitions.definition: according to what is correct for a particular situation or thing.
examples: is this the right way to the cottage?

definitions.definition: the best or most suitable of a number of possible choices for a particular purpose or occasion.
examples: he was clearly the right man for the job
synonyms: ideal; Morearchaicmeet "the right person for the job"opportune
appropriate "you've come at the right time"

definitions.definition: socially fashionable or important.
examples: he was seen at all the right places

definitions.definition: in a satisfactory, sound, or normal state or condition.
examples: that sausage doesn't smell right

definitions.definition: on, toward, or relating to the side of a human body or of a thing that is to the east when the person or thing is facing north.
examples: my right elbow

definitions.definition: complete; absolute (used for emphasis, typically in derogatory contexts).
examples: I felt a right idiot

definitions.definition: of or relating to a person or political party or grouping favoring conservative views.
examples: are you politically right, left, or center?

definitions.definition: to the furthest or most complete extent or degree (used for emphasis).
examples: the car spun right off the track
synonyms: quite "she was right at the limit of her patience"

definitions.definition: exactly; directly (used to emphasize the precise location or time of something).
examples: Harriet was standing right behind her
synonyms: smack dab "right in the middle of the village"

definitions.definition: immediately; without delaying or hesitating.
examples: I'll be right back

definitions.definition: very.
examples: it's right spooky in there!

definitions.definition: correctly.
examples: he had guessed right

definitions.definition: in the required or necessary way; properly; satisfactorily.
examples: nothing's going right for me this season
synonyms: ethically More"make sure you're treated right by the authorities"well

definitions.definition: on or to the right side.
examples: turn right at Main Street

definitions.definition: that which is morally correct, just, or honorable.
examples: she doesn't understand the difference between right and wrong
synonyms: legality "the difference between right and wrong"

definitions.definition: a moral or legal entitlement to have or obtain something or to act in a certain way.
examples: she had every right to be angry
synonyms: freedom; historicaldroit "you have the right to say no"

definitions.definition: the authority to perform, publish, film, or televise a particular work, event, etc.
examples: they sold the paperback rights

definitions.definition: the right-hand part, side, or direction.
examples: take the first turning on the right

definitions.definition: (in football or a similar sport) the right-hand half of the field when facing the opponent's goal.
short for right field.
examples: a looping single to right

definitions.definition: the right wing of an army.
a right turn.
examples: he made a right in Dorchester Avenue

definitions.definition: a road or entrance on the right.
examples: take the first right over the stream

definitions.definition: (especially in the context of boxing) a person's right fist.
a blow given with this.
examples: the young cop swung a terrific right

definitions.definition: a grouping or political party favoring conservative views and supporting capitalist economic principles.
restore to a normal or upright position.
examples: we righted the capsized dinghy
synonyms: turn back over "the way to right a capsized dinghy"

definitions.definition: restore to a normal or correct condition or situation.
examples: righting the economy demanded major cuts in defense spending

definitions.definition: redress or rectify (a wrong or mistaken action).
examples: she was determined to right the wrongs done to her father

definitions.definition: make reparation to (someone) for a wrong done to them.
examples: we'll see you righted

definitions.definition: used to indicate one's agreement with a suggestion or to acknowledge a statement or order.
examples: “Barry's here.” “Oh, right”

definitions.definition: used as a filler in speech or to introduce an utterance, exhortation, or suggestion.
examples: and I didn't think any more of it, right, but Mom said I should take him to a doctor

definitions.definition: the part of the outfield to the right of center field from the perspective of home plate.
examples: a ball hit to right field

definitions.definition: the position of the defensive player stationed in right field.
examples: he first gained attention while playing right field
